pages.title: Have you provided a night shelter or emergency accommodation on or after 1 April 2019?

components.name: QOlbCV
components.hint: Night shelter or emergency accommodation is a service with rapid access and a low barrier to entry for people experiencing rough sleeping or at imminent risk of rough sleeping.
components.title: Have you provided a night shelter or emergency accommodation on or after 1 April 2019?

components.name: affVbH
components.title: Is the night shelter or emergency accommodation communal?

components.name: ttEOXi
components.title: Is the night shelter or emergency accommodation single room accommodation?
components.hint:
A single room is separate living accommodation. It has a lockable door, four walls and a ceiling, secure window and appropriate ventilation. 
It also has access to cooking facilities and full bathroom facilities (single-use or shared). Cooking facilities are required unless this is explicitly indicated as unnecessary, for example in fully catered provision.
